original: WHEREAS , T&B and LEA wish to conduct business to develop and operate a “Tarek’s Real Estate 101” branded seminar style education business that uses, among other things, the names, images, and likenesses of Tarek El Moussa to market and sell customers real estate investing oriented education products.

However, it is understood that Tarek El Moussa shall have no responsibility or liability arising from any failure to meet customer expectations or dissatisfaction with the purchased products, except where such failure or dissatisfaction results directly from his personal acts or omissions.

original: 4. Conduct of the Business 4.1 LEA shall provide administrative and operational services for the conduct of the Business, including, marketing, event planning, sales, operations, information technologies, human resources, and class fulfillment. In consultation with T&B and subject to the licenses granted to LEA by T&B herein, LEA shall be responsible for branding the Business (including trademarks and trade dress) and creating and producing marketing collateral, sales presentations, course materials and other tangible work product and deliverables related to the conduct of the Business (collectively, “Work Product”).
ollama_generated:
4. Business Operations and Responsibilities
4.1 T&B shall delegate the authority for managing the operations and conducting the Business to LEA. This includes, but is not limited to, marketing, event coordination, sales, operations, information technology management, human resources administration, and course facilitation. In collaboration with LEA, and subject to any licenses granted by T&B to LEA, T&B shall have the flexibility to approve or suggest modifications to the branding strategy for the Business (including trademarks and trade dress), as well as the creation and production of marketing collateral, sales presentations, course materials, and other tangible work products related to the Business ("Work Product"). The responsibility for any alterations to the approved Work Product shall primarily rest with T&B.

original: 4.2 LEA and T&B shall jointly own all jointly-created work product including, but not limited to, ideas, any and all concepts, designs, Customer Data (including client lists) generated through the conduct of the Business, programs, software, reports, or other intellectual property and tangible work product, produced for the Business , regardless of whether such were incorporated into or used by the Business (collectively “Work Product”), shall be and remain the joint property of LEA and T&B when produced provided, however, (i) to the extent LEA has contributed distinct and divisible work product to the Business during the Term (“ LEA Work Product ”), such LEA Work Product shall remain frozen for a period not to exceed 90 days, during which time T&B may acquire a license for the LEA Work Product by reimbursing LEA direct and verifiable costs LEA incurred in producing the LEA Work Product during the Term and (ii) to the extent T&B has contributed distinct and divisible work product to the Business during the Term (“ T&B Work Product ”), such T&B Work Product shall remain frozen for a period not to exceed 90 days, during which time LEA may acquire license for the T&B Work Product by reimbursing T&B direct and verifiable costs T&B incurred in producing the T&B Work Product during the Term. No license or right is granted hereunder at any time from LEA to T&B, or by T&B to LEA, whether expressly or by implication, estoppel or otherwise, arising out of or related to LEA Work Product or T&B Work Product, respectively. LEA shall be the owner of all LEA Work Product when created and T&B shall be the owner of all T&B Work Product when created.
modified:
4.2 For the jointly-created work product, including but not limited to ideas, concepts, designs, customer data (including client lists), generated through the course of our Business endeavors such as programs, software, reports, or other intellectual property and tangible work product (collectively "Work Product"), it is understood that both LEA and T&B will have equal rights to ownership. However, there are exceptions:

(i) If LEA has contributed unique and separable work product to the Business during the term of this agreement ("LEA Work Product"), LEA retains exclusive ownership for a period not exceeding 90 days. During this period, T&B may acquire a non-exclusive license for the LEA Work Product by compensating LEA for any direct and verifiable costs incurred during the term of this agreement in producing the LEA Work Product.

(ii) If T&B has contributed unique and separable work product to the Business during the term of this agreement ("T&B Work Product"), T&B retains exclusive ownership for a period not exceeding 90 days. During this period, LEA may acquire a non-exclusive license for the T&B Work Product by compensating T&B for any direct and verifiable costs incurred during the term of this agreement in producing the T&B Work Product.

Under no circumstances does this agreement grant any license or right to either party, whether expressly or implied, related to LEA Work Product or T&B Work Product, respectively. Each party shall be recognized as the sole owner of its respective work product upon creation.

original: 5. Brand Development and Launch 5.1 T&B shall assist LEA in developing the Business as reasonably requested by LEA from time to time, including, but not limited to, assisting in the development of sales presentations and course materials and consultation with LEA’s sales and marketing organization to ensure that they reflect T&B Personality’s investing philosophy. T&B shall provide factual substantiation of T&B Personality’s biography and investing success stories provided by T&B for use by LEA in the conduct of the Business.
ollama_generated:
5. Brand Integration and Deployment
5.1 LEA shall collaborate with T&B, as reasonably necessary at the discretion of T&B, in the integration and deployment of their brand within the Business. This collaboration may include, but is not limited to, reviewing and providing feedback on sales presentations, course materials, and consultations with T&B's sales and marketing organization to align with LEA's strategic vision. LEA shall obtain and verify all factual substantiation of T&B Personality’s biography and investing success stories provided by T&B for use in the conduct of the Business.

In this revised clause, T&B has more discretion over their collaboration with LEA, and the responsibility for obtaining and verifying the facts of T&B's biography and investing success stories shifts to LEA.

ollama_generated:
9. Royalty Compensation and Reporting Obligations
9.1. For the rights bestowed upon LEA by T&B, T&B hereby agrees to receive from LEA:

In light of the privileges conferred upon LEA by T&B, LEA consents to remit to T&B:

This modification inverts the condition and shifts the responsibility from LEA to T&B, while maintaining a professional tone.

original: 9.1.2 Marketing Royalty : Marketing Royalty: In consideration of T&B Personality providing commercially reasonable, regular and periodic marketing support to LEA substantially in accordance with Schedule 2 attached to this Agreement and incorporated herein by reference, which LEA agrees to request and accept from T&B consistently during the Term, LEA will pay T&M a royalty in addition to the Base Royalty (“Marketing Royalty”) which shall be comprised of and calculated at [●%]  of LEA’s Cash Sales made from the sale of Products at live events and [●%]  of LEA’s Cash Sales made from the sale of Products at on-line webinars. For the avoidance of doubt, the Base Royalty and Marketing Royalty shall be cumulative and calculated independently, without overlap. Further, nothing herein shall be construed to enable LEA to refuse to accept reasonable, regular and periodic marketing support from T&B as a means to avoid paying T&B a Marketing Royalty. In the event, T&B offers, but LEA refuses to request or accept reasonable, regular and periodic marketing support from T&B during the Term, LEA shall continue to be obligated to pay T&B a Marketing Royalty as if such marketing support had been requested and accepted by 9.2 Minimum Guaranteed Royalty : In consideration of the exclusivity rights granted to LEA, commencing with the seventh (7th) month of the Term and continuing each year of the Term thereafter, the minimum Royalties payable to T&B each month shall be the greater of the (i) applicable monthly Base Royalty and Marketing Royalty or (ii) $200,000.
modified:
9.1.2 Marketing Fee Obligation: In the event that LEA chooses not to request or accept marketing support from T&B Personality, as specified in Schedule 2 attached and incorporated herein by reference, during the Term, LEA will forgo the payment of any Marketing Fee, additional to the Base Royalty. This Marketing Fee would have been calculated as [●%] of LEA's Cash Sales made from the sale of Products at live events and [●%] of LEA’s Cash Sales made from the sale of Products at on-line webinars. For clarity, the Base Royalty and any potential Marketing Fee shall be independent calculations, without overlap or cumulation. It is expressly understood that LEA's choice to forego marketing support does not absolve it from paying T&B the Base Royalty. In the event, T&B offers marketing support but LEA chooses not to utilize it during the Term, LEA shall remain obligated to pay T&B a Base Royalty in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.

9.2 Minimum Base Guarantee: Granted the exclusivity rights held by LEA, beginning with the seventh (7th) month of the Term and continuing each year thereafter, the minimum royalties payable to T&B each month shall be the lesser of the (i) applicable monthly Base Royalty or (ii) $200,000. This provision is intended to provide a minimum payment to T&B regardless of any marketing support provided during the Term.

original: 11.4. LEA shall, for a period of six (6) months (“Sell-Off Period”) following the effective date of termination of the license granted by T&B hereunder, have the right to fulfill commitments made to customers during the Term. The provisions of this Agreement shall apply with full force and effect during the Sell-Off Period. modified: 11.4. Upon termination of the license granted by T&B, T&B shall have the obligation to allow LEA a six (6) month grace period ("Sell-Off Period") during which LEA may fulfill commitments made to customers during the Term. The provisions of this Agreement shall not apply during the Sell-Off Period, but any obligations or restrictions imposed on LEA by law shall remain in effect. Upon expiration of the Sell-Off Period, it shall be the responsibility of LEA to cease and desist from using or displaying any forms of advertising containing any of the Licensed Marks.

original: 12.1 Each party shall defend, indemnify and hold harmless the other party and their respective Affiliates and their respective officers, directors, agents, contractors, employees, successor, and assigns from and against all claims, demands or causes of action, as well as any and all damages, expenses, costs, interest and reasonable legal fees, including such fees incurred on appeal, in any way related to, arising out of or connected with a breach of the indemnifying party’s representations, warranties or covenants under this Agreement. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, LEA shall defend, hold harmless and indemnify T&B and T&B’s agents and employees from and against any and all claims, demands, losses, disputes, causes of action or damages, including, without limitation, FTC actions or other regulatory actions, and/or attorneys’ fees arising out of or relating to the promotion, distribution and/or sale of any financial education programs, products or services, including (but not limited to) live presentations, print advertising, radio advertising, direct mail, outbound calls, email marketing, affiliate marketing, online advertising, infomercials and other marketing methods, by or through LEA, In any instance to which such indemnities pertain, LEA shall obtain and maintain necessary insurance, including, without limitation, Commercial General Liability Insurance, including product liability insurance, trademark infringement, copyright infringement, defamation, contractual liability and personal and advertising injury liability insurance in an amount no less than ten million dollars ($10,000,000.00) per occurrence and ten million dollars ($10,000,000.00) aggregate combined single limit. T&B and Tarek El Moussa shall be named as an additional insured on such insurance and proof of such inclusion shall be provided to T&B.
ollama_generated:
12.1 Each party shall have the right, but not the obligation, to seek indemnification from the other party and their respective Affiliates, officers, directors, agents, contractors, employees, successors, and assigns for any claims, demands, or causes of action, as well as any damages, expenses, costs, interest, and reasonable legal fees, including those incurred on appeal, that may arise from a breach of this Agreement's indemnifying party's representations, warranties, or covenants. In specific cases where T&B requires indemnification, LEA will be responsible for defending, holding harmless, and indemnifying T&B and its agents and employees against any claims, demands, losses, disputes, causes of action, or damages related to the promotion, distribution, and sale of financial education programs, products, or services.

In instances involving such indemnities, LEA will procure and maintain required insurance, including but not limited to Commercial General Liability Insurance, product liability insurance, trademark infringement, copyright infringement, defamation, contractual liability, and personal and advertising injury liability insurance. The coverage shall have a minimum per occurrence limit of ten million dollars ($10,000,000.00) and an aggregate combined single limit of ten million dollars ($10,000,000.00). T&B and Tarek El Moussa will be added as additional insureds on such insurance policies, with proof of this inclusion provided to T&B upon request. This indemnification clause does not extend to any claims arising from LEA's intentional or grossly negligent actions.

original: 14.1 Waiver . The failure of either party at any time or times to demand strict performance by the other party of any of the terms, covenants or conditions set forth herein shall not be construed as a continuing waiver or relinquishment thereof, and either party may at any time demand strict and complete performance by the other party of said terms, covenants and conditions.
ollama_generated: 14.1 Waiver and Time Limits . Either party reserves the right to demand timely and full adherence by the other party to these terms at any time following the expiration of this reasonable period.
